citation.article-title: 'Candidatus Phytoplasma omanense', associated with witches'-broom of Cassia italica (Mill.) Spreng. in Oman
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: ‘Candidatus Phytoplasma omanense’ [N.L. neut. adj. omanense of or pertaining to Oman (Mollicutes)] NC; NA; O, wall-less; NAS (GenBank accession number EF666051), oligonucleotide sequences of unique regions of the 16S rRNA gene are 5′-AAAAAACAGT-3′ (467–474), 5′-TTGC-3′ (642–645), 5′-GTTAAAG-3′ (853–861), 5′-TAATT-3′ (1010–1014) and 5′-AAATT-3′ (1052–1056); P (Cassia italica, phloem); M]. As described previously (IRPCM Phytoplasma/Spiroplasma Working Team – Phytoplasma Taxonomy Group, 2004), specific nucleotide signatures A at position 242, T at position 286 and T at position 1247 that are characteristic of ‘Ca. Phytoplasma’ are present in the sequence of ‘Ca. P. omanense’ strains IM-1, IM-2, IM-3 and IM-4. IM-1 is the reference strain, with GenBank/EMBL/DDBJ accession number EF666051. DNA samples from these strains are available from the authors.
